com.ojcoleman.europa.core

Class Species<G extends Genotype<?>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ojcoleman.europa.configurable.Observable

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Stringable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    NEATSpecies

    public class Species<G extends Genotype<?>>
extends PrototypeBase
    Represents a species in the evolutionary algorithm.
    Author:
    O. J. Coleman

    • Method Detail

      • addMember

        public void addMember(Individual<G,?> member)
        Adds the given Individual to this Species. This should generally only be called by a Speciator.

      • removeMember

        public void removeMember(Individual<G,?> member)
        Removes the given Individual from this Species. This should generally only be called by a Speciator.

      • addMemberRemoveFromCurrent

        public void addMemberRemoveFromCurrent(Individual<G,?> member)
        Adds the given Individual to this Species., removing it if necessary from it's current Species. This should generally only be called by a Speciator.

      • getMembers

        public java.util.Set<Individual<G,?>> getMembers()
        Returns an unmodifiable view of the members of this Species.

      • size

        public int size()
        Returns the number of members in this Species.

      • getAge

        public int getAge()
        Returns the number of generations this species has persisted for.

      • incrementAge

        public void incrementAge()
        Increments the number of generations this species has persisted for.

      • getAverageRank

        public double getAverageRank()
        Get the average rank of the members of this species. This is used for "fitness sharing"

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Returns true iff there are no Individuals in this Species.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Removes all the members from this Species.
